implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to fetch all tasks; used to display tasks in the UI and for management operations.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On GET /tasks:
    Call database.get_tasks()
    Return list of all tasks

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task with required fields; called from frontend TaskForm.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On POST /tasks with TaskCreate:
    Call database.add_task(task)
    Return the created task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task; called from frontend TaskForm for editing.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On PUT /tasks/{task_id} with TaskCreate:
    Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
    If not found, raise 404
    Return updated task

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task; called from frontend TaskItem.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On DELETE /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If not found, raise 404
    Return success message

implementation.name: add_task

implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Create new Task with unique id and provided fields
Append to tasks list
Save tasks
Return new task

implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Find task by id
Replace with updated Task
Save tasks

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes a Task object by id; called by delete_task endpoint.

Get all tasks
Remove task with matching id
Save tasks
Return True if deleted, else False

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: UI form for adding and editing tasks; collects title, description, priority, due date, and tag.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display form fields for title, description, priority, category (tag), due date
On submit:
    Call onSubmit with task data
    If editing, include completed status

implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: UI for displaying a single task; allows marking as completed/pending, editing, and deleting.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display task details
Show completed status visually
Buttons:
    Mark as completed/pending (calls onToggleComplete)
    Edit (calls onEdit)
    Delete (calls onDelete)

missing_implementations: Tasks cannot be assigned to events.
Multiple tasks cannot be assigned to a single event.
No explicit 'tag' field; 'category' may be used as tag.
No explicit status field for Completed/Pending in backend model (frontend uses 'completed', but backend model may not persist it).

implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Provides an API endpoint to retrieve all tasks. This is related to the requirement only in that tasks are managed, but not assigned to events.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a GET request is made to /tasks:
    Call database.get_tasks()
    Return the list of tasks

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Provides an API endpoint to create a new task. This is related to the requirement only in that tasks are created, but not assigned to events.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with task data:
    Call database.add_task(task)
    Return the created task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Provides an API endpoint to update an existing task. This is related to the requirement only in that tasks are updated, but not assigned to events.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a PUT request is made to /tasks/{task_id} with updated data:
    Call database.update_task(task_id, task)
    If no task found, raise 404 error
    Return the updated task

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Provides an API endpoint to delete a task. This is related to the requirement only in that tasks are deleted, but not assigned to events.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a DELETE request is made to /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call database.delete_task(task_id)
    If not successful, raise 404 error

missing_implementations: A new event must include a name, description, and location.
Enables users to add events with a name, description, and location.
Events can have multiple tasks assigned to them.
